name: kombatmedik
text: The first achewood strip I've ever read. God damn this was a great story arc.

name: abe
text: You just have to put on your own favorite personal anthem ever and imagine those hands swiping key rings off pegs... two old boys just standing tall..

name: sandranista
text: You ain't wanna be challenging the JEEPS, dogg.  Daammnn.

name: rayonatoilet
text: Dogdammit!

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, dboothe, mortshire, bug)

name: wulvaine
text: OK, I think people just lamed this comment because they don't like Saint for some reason. There was nothing lame about that.

name: saint
text: I know what to expect.  It's like virtual vigilante justice.

name: mustakrakesh
text: BE THE RULING BODY!!

name: omegatron
text: Become the ruling body, dude!

name: hellofyellin
text: This is by far the most epic story arc.  Some fine funny-strip writing.

name: wehavemagnums
text: HELL YES

name: patkun
text:
Become the ruling body!

Words to live by.

name: jemof
text: "Become the ruling body" became my mantra after reading this strip.

name: falseprophet
text: I thought those exact same words as soon as I read this.

name: jamb23
text: Ray's cry would later go on to inspire the ethical code of eBay Platinum Reserve.

name: ctrl_z
text: Agreed.

name: paco
text: A comment left by paco was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by TommyTheBrat, riotdejaneiro, hellsfruition)

name: electricjelly
text: the left hand grabbing a jeep key has the same black wristband that rodney's got

name: andrew_
text: oh damn

name: thatcrazycommie
text: From the GOF hardcover: "Many older-generation fighters honor Morris's memory and wrongful slaying by wearing black wristbands. Fighters of more recent decades, especially those born after Morris's death, tend not to wear the band, as it is seen as 'disrespectful posing' and 'mere fashion' to them (p. 98)." So that answers that!

name: cpnglxynchos
text: thank you for the explanation. i haven't gotten said book yet.

name: gormster
text: Maybe's it's a wristband like you get at concerts, like it's your proof that you're allowed in the tower?

name: dasilodavi
text: Maybe, but that other guy grabbing keys doesn't seem to have one.  I like to think it's some sort of mark for being a former champion.

name: gormster
text: Other wrist.

name: tagrineth
text: Actually look how the fingers are curled under the thumb and how the motion lines are oriented.  They're both right hands.  One has a black wristband, the other does not.

name: professorhazard
text: He wore it before he was champion.

name: relaxing
text: Oh shiiiiiiiiiit!

name: jerkface
text: I propose more work must be done to understand the post-Parent Trap era.

name: kreuzkopf
text: Rodney's so raw he doesn't even say something to the effect that he'll see Ray later.

name: woodenteeth
text: A comment left by woodenteeth was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, Troy_Convers, Hyetal)

name: stormagnet
text: I haven't read far enough to know how well supported this is or isn't in the strip, but this is kind of a Male Cat Thing. They are hella territorial, and the mother cats chase them off when having kittens. Because, as one of my friends learned the hard way, it is not unusual for male cats to kill their own sons.

name: woodenteeth
text: oooooh shit. i really hope Onstad is going to play out their relationship in a Zoologically accurate way. Your post brings life to the possibilities!

name: senseihollywood
text: that, and it's the Code of the Fight...those are the rules, Ray must put the beating on Beef, and Rodney must ride down on his son...to do any less would be a dishonor

name: woodenteeth
text: Fuck dishonour. Dishonour is driving a jeep over your own son because you have the moral code of an 8 year (i.e. acting as if all rules are absolute).

name: deusoma
text: Somebody earlier pointed out that Ramses was wearing a medallion just like Ray's in the first flashback image of him. Here I see that he's still wearing it, so it must be a coincidence.

name: omegatron
text:
They do both wear medallions.

Though somehow I don't think that Ramses' medallion once belonged to King Chochacho, the Fun God.

name: jollysaintpete
text: ahahah woodenteeth has issues with papa

name: woodenteeth
text: I talked to Freud. He wasn't happy.

name: direhaggis
text: There is some stone cold Smokey and the Bandit action coming straight quick.

name: i_love_kate
text:
Those sad little graves are an unwarrantedly depressing aspect of the strip. Mainly because I have an overactive imagination, and it immidiately calls to mind a fabrication of what the three siblings' tragic, brutal last moments might have been like.

Maybe I'll share, one day.

name: fatbatmat
text: I love ham
